intro: Sedum jurgensenii subsp. attenuatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of North America. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, blue-green leaves that are adapted to store water. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements make it a popular choice for landscaping in dry climates.
